title: SQL Expression to Produce 'JOE'

options.text: SELECT FROM TABLE dbtabl FIELDS Of1, substring(upper('mr joe doe'), 4, 3) AS f2_sub_up, f3,...
SELECT FROM TABLE dbtabl FIELDS Of1, substring(lower(upper( 'mr joe doe' ) ), 4, 3) AS f2_sub_lo_up, f3,
SELECT FROM TABLE dbtabl FIELDS Of1, left(lower(substring( 'mr joe doe', 4, 3)), 3) AS f2_left_lo_sub, f3,

title: FOR ALL ENTRIES Benefit
stem: How does the 'SELECT FOR ALL ENTRIES' statement in ABAP improve performance when retrieving data from multiple tables?

options.text: By reducing the number of database accesses
By automatically creating indexes on the tables

title: EXACT Operator Exceptions
stem: Which of the following patterns raise an exception when using the EXACT operator? There are 3 correct answers to this question.

options.text: DATA: gv_target TYPE string. CONSTANTS: gco_string TYPE string VALUE '0123456789ABCDEF'. gv_target = EXACT #( gco_string+5(5) ).
DATA: gv_target TYPE c LENGTH 5. CONSTANTS: gco_string TYPE string VALUE '0123456789ABCDEF'. gv_target = EXACT #( gco_string+5(6) ).
DATA: gv_target TYPE d. CONSTANTS: gco_date TYPE d VALUE '20331233'. gv_target = EXACT #( gco_date ).
DATA: ev_target TYPE p DECIMALS 3. CONSTANTS: gco_int1 TYPE i VALUE 2. ev_target = EXACT #( 2 / gco_int1 ).
DATA: gv_target TYPE p DECIMALS 2. CONSTANTS: gco_int1 TYPE i VALUE 3. gv_target = EXACT #( 2 * gco_int1 ).

title: ABAP Shared Objects True Statements
stem: Which of the following are true about ABAP Shared Objects? There are 3 correct answers to this question.

options.text: They offer a way to cache data in application memory
They are used for inter-process communication
They are stored in the database layer
They can be accessed by multiple users simultaneously
They provide a mechanism for memory management

To cache data on the database server
To back up data on client devices
To encrypt data before sending it to the client

title: Valid ABAP SQL Statements
stem: Which of the following ABAP SQL statements are valid? There are 2 correct answers to this question.

options.text: SELECT FROM /dmo/connection FIELDS carrid, airpfrom, MAX(distance) AS dist_max, MIN(distance) AS dist_min INTO TABLE @DATA(it_hits)
SELECT FROM /dmo/connection FIELDS MAX(distance) AS dist_max, MIN(distance) AS dist_min INTO TABLE @DATA(it_hits).
SELECT FROM /dmo/connection FIELDS carrid, airpfrom, MAX(distance) AS dist_max, MIN(distance) AS dist_min GROUP BY carrid, airpfrom INTO TABLE @DATA(it_hits)
SELECT FROM /dmo/connection FIELDS carrid, airpfrom GROUP BY carrid, connid INTO TABLE @DATA(it_hits).

title: Interface/Class Calls and NEW
stem: Given interface if1 with method m1 and class cl1 implementing if1 plus class method m2; which statements are valid? There are 3 correct answers to this question.

options.text: go_if1 may call method m2 with go_if1->m2(...).
go_cl1 may call method m1 with go_cl1->if1~m1().
Instead of go_cl1 = NEW #(...) you could use go_if1 = NEW #(...).
go_if1 may call method m1 with go_if1->m1().
Instead of go_cl1 = NEW #(...) you could use go_if1 = NEW cl1(...).
